intro: Oritrophium ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and prairies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine, rusty-colored hairs. Oritrophium ferrugineum is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
